summary: Cleveland, Ohio, is a big city on Lake Erie, near the Canadian border. With around 370,000 people, it's the second-largest city in Ohio. Founded in 1796, it grew into an industrial powerhouse in the 19th century. Today, its economy includes education, healthcare, and manufacturing. Cleveland is home to many cultural attractions, like the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and the Cleveland Museum of Art. It's also known for its sports teams, such as the Cleveland Browns and the Cleveland Guardians. The city has several nicknames, including "The Forest City."
title: Cleveland
